presenter.name: Gwang Ha Kim
presenter.title: Korea
presenter.bio: EUS-based algorithmic approach in the work-up of the subepithelial lesions

slide.title: EUS-based algorithmic approach in the work-up of the subepithelial lesions
slide.titleNormalized: eus-based algorithmic approach in the work-up of the subepithelial lesions
slide.notes: Thank you for you kind introduction. The title I speak today is EUS for subepithelial lesion: non-invasive approach.
slide.notesNormalized: thank you for you kind introduction. the title i speak today is eus for subepithelial lesion: non-invasive approach.
slide.notesHtml:
Thank you for you kind introduction.

The title I speak today is EUS for subepithelial lesion: non-invasive approach.
slide.text: EUS-based algorithmic approach in the work-up of the subepithelial lesions Department of Internal Medicine Pusan National University School of Medicine Gwang Ha Kim

slide.title: Subepithelial lesion (SEL)
slide.notes: Instead of subepithelial lesion, we usually use a term “submucosal tumor (SMT).” Due to the increase of health check-up endoscopy, the incidence of subepithelial lesion is increasing.
slide.notesNormalized: instead of subepithelial lesion, we usually use a term “submucosal tumor (smt).” due to the increase of health check-up endoscopy, the incidence of subepithelial lesion is increasing.
slide.notesHtml:
Instead of subepithelial lesion, we usually use a term “submucosal tumor (SMT).”

Due to the increase of health check-up endoscopy, the incidence of subepithelial lesion is increasing.
slide.text: Subepithelial lesion (SEL) Submucosal lesion Spectrum of histologic lesions located beneath the mucosal lining of GI tract Relatively common finding at upper endoscopy 3.1% (2,685/87,578) Korean EUS Study Group (unpublished data)

slide.title: What do we worry about in SEL?
slide.titleNormalized: what do we worry about in sel?
slide.notes: If we meet the subepithelial lesion in clinics, we worry about whether it is benign or malignant.
slide.notesNormalized: if we meet the subepithelial lesion in clinics, we worry about whether it is benign or malignant.
slide.notesHtml: If we meet the subepithelial lesion in clinics, we worry about whether it is benign or malignant.
slide.text: What do we worry about in SEL? Benign (>85%) Malignant (<15%)

slide.title: Diagnostic weapons for SELs
slide.notes: There are several diagnostic modalities for subepithelial lesions. Today, I focus on the diagnostic EUS.
slide.notesNormalized: there are several diagnostic modalities for subepithelial lesions. today, i focus on the diagnostic eus.
slide.notesHtml:
There are several diagnostic modalities for subepithelial lesions.

Today, I focus on the diagnostic EUS.
slide.text: Diagnostic weapons for SELs Endoscopy ± biopsy EUS EUS-guided tissue acquisition Endoscopic resection

slide.title: Normal gut wall
slide.notes: On EUS, normal gut wall consists of 5 layers. With using high-frequency EUS, the gut wall consists of 9 layers.
slide.notesNormalized: on eus, normal gut wall consists of 5 layers. with using high-frequency eus, the gut wall consists of 9 layers.
slide.notesHtml:
On EUS, normal gut wall consists of 5 layers.

With using high-frequency EUS, the gut wall consists of 9 layers.
slide.text: Normal gut wall Normal esophageal wall (20 MHz) 1,2 epithelium 3 lamina propria 4 muscularis mucosa 5 submucosa 6 inner circular muscle 7 intermuscular connective tissue 8 outer longitudinal muscle 9 adventitia Normal gastric wall (7.5 MHz) fluid-mucosa interface mucosa submucosa muscularis propria subserosa/serosa

slide.title: Schema of GI wall on EUS
slide.titleNormalized: schema of gi wall on eus
slide.text: Schema of GI wall on EUS Dig Endosc 2017;29:431

slide.title: What features should we describe during EUS?
slide.titleNormalized: what features should we describe during eus?
slide.notes: During EUS, we must get information such as ….
slide.notesNormalized: during eus, we must get information such as ….
slide.notesHtml: During EUS, we must get information such as ….
slide.text: What features should we describe during EUS? Location Layer Echogenicity Homogeneity Marginal border clarity Growth pattern Size Presence cystic change hyperechogenic spots calcification marginal halo

slide.title: SELs : 2nd layer
slide.notes: From now, I will show you typical EUS cases. First is the lesion located in the 2nd hypoechoic layer. These cases are diagnosed as leiomyoma, granular cell tumor, carcinoid tumor an so on.
slide.notesNormalized: from now, i will show you typical eus cases. first is the lesion located in the 2nd hypoechoic layer. these cases are diagnosed as leiomyoma, granular cell tumor, carcinoid tumor an so on.
slide.notesHtml:
From now, I will show you typical EUS cases.

First is the lesion located in the 2nd hypoechoic layer.

These cases are diagnosed as leiomyoma, granular cell tumor, carcinoid tumor an so on.
slide.text: SELs : 2nd layer Leiomyoma Granular cell tumor Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp Neuroendocrine tumor MALT lymphoma Brunner’s gland hyperplasia

slide.title: SELs : 2nd and 3rd layer
slide.notes: Sometimes the afore-mentioned lesions are also located in the 2nd and 3rd layer.
slide.notesNormalized: sometimes the afore-mentioned lesions are also located in the 2nd and 3rd layer.
slide.notesHtml: Sometimes the afore-mentioned lesions are also located in the 2nd and 3rd layer.
slide.text: SELs : 2nd and 3rd layer Granular cell tumor Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp Neuroendocrine tumor MALT lymphoma Ectopic pancreas Brunner’s gland hyperplasia

slide.title: Granular cell tumor vs Leiomyoma
slide.notes: At first, the leiomyoma is seen as hypoechoic lesion with clear margin in 2nd layer. Granular cell tumor also has similar EUS findings at a glance. However, by using a high frequency EUS probe, there are some discriminating points between them. This is the result of immunohistochemical staining. The margin of granular cell tumor is somewhat unclear, but the margin of leiomyoma is clear. Therefore, white-to-yellowish surface color, hyperechoic in comparison with surrouding m. echo, and unclear border suggest that this lesion is granular cell tumor.
slide.notesNormalized: at first, the leiomyoma is seen as hypoechoic lesion with clear margin in 2nd layer. granular cell tumor also has similar eus findings at a glance. however, by using a high frequency eus probe, there are some discriminating points between them. this is the result of immunohistochemical staining. the margin of granular cell tumor is somewhat unclear, but the margin of leiomyoma is clear. therefore, white-to-yellowish surface color, hyperechoic in comparison with surrouding m. echo, and unclear border suggest that this lesion is granular cell tumor.
slide.notesHtml:
At first, the leiomyoma is seen as hypoechoic lesion with clear margin in 2nd layer.

Granular cell tumor also has similar EUS findings at a glance.

However, by using a high frequency EUS probe, there are some discriminating points between them.

This is the result of immunohistochemical staining. The margin of granular cell tumor is somewhat unclear, but the margin of leiomyoma is clear.

Therefore, white-to-yellowish surface color, hyperechoic in comparison with surrouding m. echo, and unclear border suggest that this lesion is granular cell tumor.
slide.text: Granular cell tumorf Granular cell tumor vs Leiomyoma Leiomyoma Kim GH et al. Scand J Gastroenterol 2011;46:142 A A EUS features Sensitivity (%) Specificity (%) PPV (%) NPV (%) Accuracy (%) White-to-yellowish color 85.7 90.0 80.0 93.1 88.6 Hyperechoic in comparison with surrounding m. echo 64.3 93.3 91.8 84.8 84.1 Unclear border 85.7 93.3 85.7 95.3 90.1 Of the above 3 features ≥ one 100 80.0 70.0 100 86.4 ≥ two 85.7 96.7 92.3 93.5 93.2 all 50.0 100 100 81.1 84.1

slide.title: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp
slide.notes: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear margin in 2nd and/or 3rd layer.
slide.notesNormalized: inflammatory fibrinoid polyp is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear margin in 2nd and/or 3rd layer.
slide.notesHtml: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear margin in 2nd and/or 3rd layer.
slide.text: Inflammatory fibrinoid polyp

slide.title: Neuroendocrine tumor
slide.notes: Carcinoid tumor is usually seen as hypoechoic lesion in 2nd and 3rd layer. First case, the lesion is located only in 2nd layer. Second and third case, the lesions are extended to deep submucosal layer.
slide.notesNormalized: carcinoid tumor is usually seen as hypoechoic lesion in 2nd and 3rd layer. first case, the lesion is located only in 2nd layer. second and third case, the lesions are extended to deep submucosal layer.
slide.notesHtml:
Carcinoid tumor is usually seen as hypoechoic lesion in 2nd and 3rd layer.

First case, the lesion is located only in 2nd layer.

Second and third case, the lesions are extended to deep submucosal layer.
slide.text: Neuroendocrine tumor

slide.title: Brunner’s gland hyperplasia
slide.notes: Brunner gland hyperplasia on duodenum is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear border in 2nd and 3rd layer. Sometimes the lesion includes septate cystic area or focal hyperechoic area.
slide.notesNormalized: brunner gland hyperplasia on duodenum is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear border in 2nd and 3rd layer. sometimes the lesion includes septate cystic area or focal hyperechoic area.
slide.notesHtml:
Brunner gland hyperplasia on duodenum is seen as hypoechoic lesion with unclear border in 2nd and 3rd layer.

Sometimes the lesion includes septate cystic area or focal hyperechoic area.
slide.text: Brunner’s gland hyperplasia

slide.title: SELs : 3rd layer
slide.notes: Next, if the lesion is located in the 3rd submucosal layer, the lesion would be diagnosed as lipoma, cyst, AV malformation an so on.
slide.notesNormalized: next, if the lesion is located in the 3rd submucosal layer, the lesion would be diagnosed as lipoma, cyst, av malformation an so on.
slide.notesHtml: Next, if the lesion is located in the 3rd submucosal layer, the lesion would be diagnosed as lipoma, cyst, AV malformation an so on.
slide.text: SELs : 3rd layer Lipoma Cyst Gastritis cystica profunda Lymphangiectasia Arteriovenous malformation Varices Anisakiasis – chronic type

slide.title: Lipoma
slide.notes: Lipoma is seen as hyperechoic lesion with clear margin in 3rd layer. During EUS examination, we can observe the EUS cushion sign (+). Sometimes, the lesion is seen as hypoechoic lesion and so it is misdiagnosed as stromal tumor. In this situation, CT is more helpful to diagnose lipoma.
slide.notesNormalized: lipoma is seen as hyperechoic lesion with clear margin in 3rd layer. during eus examination, we can observe the eus cushion sign (+). sometimes, the lesion is seen as hypoechoic lesion and so it is misdiagnosed as stromal tumor. in this situation, ct is more helpful to diagnose lipoma.
slide.notesHtml:
Lipoma is seen as hyperechoic lesion with clear margin in 3rd layer. During EUS examination, we can observe the EUS cushion sign (+).

Sometimes, the lesion is seen as hypoechoic lesion and so it is misdiagnosed as stromal tumor.

In this situation, CT is more helpful to diagnose lipoma.
slide.text: Lipoma

slide.title: Gastritis cystica profunda
slide.notes: Gastritis cystica profunda is usually seen as anechoic cystic lesion in 3rd layer. However, like this, the solid type gastritis cystica profunda is present and it is misdiagnosed as lymphoma or stromal tumor.
slide.notesNormalized: gastritis cystica profunda is usually seen as anechoic cystic lesion in 3rd layer. however, like this, the solid type gastritis cystica profunda is present and it is misdiagnosed as lymphoma or stromal tumor.
slide.notesHtml:
Gastritis cystica profunda is usually seen as anechoic cystic lesion in 3rd layer.

However, like this, the solid type gastritis cystica profunda is present and it is misdiagnosed as lymphoma or stromal tumor.
slide.text: Gastritis cystica profunda

slide.title: Arteriovenous malformation
slide.notes: AV malformation is usually found in the esophagus. The lesion is usually seen as hyperechoic lesion in 3rd submucosal layer. Interestingly, the echo pattern changes into more hypoechoic during examination like hemangioma in the liver. Also, it has peripheral draining vein.
slide.notesNormalized: av malformation is usually found in the esophagus. the lesion is usually seen as hyperechoic lesion in 3rd submucosal layer. interestingly, the echo pattern changes into more hypoechoic during examination like hemangioma in the liver. also, it has peripheral draining vein.
slide.notesHtml:
AV malformation is usually found in the esophagus.

The lesion is usually seen as hyperechoic lesion in 3rd submucosal layer.

Interestingly, the echo pattern changes into more hypoechoic during examination like hemangioma in the liver.

Also, it has peripheral draining vein.
slide.text: Arteriovenous malformation

slide.title: Anisakiasis – chronic type
slide.notes: Chronic anisakiasis is sometimes misdiagnosed as GIST. In my experience, the characteristic findings of chronic anisakiasis are inhomogenous hypoechoic lesions with unclear border in 3rd and/or 4th layer. Inside the lesion, hyperechoic tubular structures suggesting anisakiasis worm are seen.
slide.notesNormalized: chronic anisakiasis is sometimes misdiagnosed as gist. in my experience, the characteristic findings of chronic anisakiasis are inhomogenous hypoechoic lesions with unclear border in 3rd and/or 4th layer. inside the lesion, hyperechoic tubular structures suggesting anisakiasis worm are seen.
slide.notesHtml:
Chronic anisakiasis is sometimes misdiagnosed as GIST.

In my experience, the characteristic findings of chronic anisakiasis are inhomogenous hypoechoic lesions with unclear border in 3rd and/or 4th layer.

Inside the lesion, hyperechoic tubular structures suggesting anisakiasis worm are seen.
slide.text: Anisakiasis – chronic type Kim GH et al. Gastroenterol Res Pract 2018;8562792

slide.title: SELs : 4th layer
slide.notes: Next is the lesion located at the 4th layer. Because we consider the malignant potential, this situation is very important for EUS examiner. This lesion is diagnosed as leiomyoma, GIST, Schwannoma, glomus tumor, or ectopic pancreas.
slide.notesNormalized: next is the lesion located at the 4th layer. because we consider the malignant potential, this situation is very important for eus examiner. this lesion is diagnosed as leiomyoma, gist, schwannoma, glomus tumor, or ectopic pancreas.
slide.notesHtml:
Next is the lesion located at the 4th layer.

Because we consider the malignant potential, this situation is very important for EUS examiner.

This lesion is diagnosed as leiomyoma, GIST, Schwannoma, glomus tumor, or ectopic pancreas.
slide.text: SELs : 4th layer Leiomyoma Schwannoma GIST Glomus tumor Ectopic pancreas

slide.title: Leiomyoma
slide.notes: Leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia and upper body. The lesion is seen as homogenously, hypoechoic lesion with clear border. The echogenicity of leiomyoma is similar to the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.
slide.notesNormalized: leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia and upper body. the lesion is seen as homogenously, hypoechoic lesion with clear border. the echogenicity of leiomyoma is similar to the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.
slide.notesHtml:
Leiomyoma usually locates in the cardia and upper body.

The lesion is seen as homogenously, hypoechoic lesion with clear border.

The echogenicity of leiomyoma is similar to the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.
slide.text: Leiomyoma

slide.title: Schwannoma
slide.notes: Schwannoma is usually found in the body. The lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border. The echogenicity of schwannoma is somewhat lower than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo. Also, the peripheral halo is seen.
slide.notesNormalized: schwannoma is usually found in the body. the lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border. the echogenicity of schwannoma is somewhat lower than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo. also, the peripheral halo is seen.
slide.notesHtml:
Schwannoma is usually found in the body.

The lesion is seen as inhomogenously hypoechoic lesion with clear border.

The echogenicity of schwannoma is somewhat lower than the echogenicity of surrounding m. echo.

Also, the peripheral halo is seen.
slide.text: Schwannoma

slide.title: GIST
slide.notes: If the malignant potential of GIST increase, the cystic change, margin lobulation and increased size is usually seen.
slide.notesNormalized: if the malignant potential of gist increase, the cystic change, margin lobulation and increased size is usually seen.
slide.notesHtml: If the malignant potential of GIST increase, the cystic change, margin lobulation and increased size is usually seen.
slide.text: GIST

slide.title: DDx points in GI mesenchymal tumors
slide.titleNormalized: ddx points in gi mesenchymal tumors
slide.text: DDx points in GI mesenchymal tumors Kim GH et al. World J Gastroenterol 2009;15:3376

slide.title: Ectopic pancreas
slide.notes: Last case is the ectopic pancreas. The characteristic EUS findings are -----.
slide.notesNormalized: last case is the ectopic pancreas. the characteristic eus findings are -----.
slide.notesHtml:
Last case is the ectopic pancreas.

The characteristic EUS findings are -----.
slide.text:
Ectopic pancreas Characteristic EUS features Indistinct border Margin lobulation Anechoic duct-like structures Mural growth pattern Location within two or more layers
Kim GH et al. J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2011;26:1441 Kim GH et al. Word J Gastroenterol 2010;16:4589

slide.title: Superficial type
slide.notes: I classified the EUS findings of ectopic pancreas into two types: superficial type and deep type. In superficial type, the lesion is located in 2nd or 3rd layer. In deep type, the lesion is located in 3rd, 4th, 5th layer. Therefore, the deep type ectopic pancreas is often misdiagnosed as GIST.
slide.notesNormalized: i classified the eus findings of ectopic pancreas into two types: superficial type and deep type. in superficial type, the lesion is located in 2nd or 3rd layer. in deep type, the lesion is located in 3rd, 4th, 5th layer. therefore, the deep type ectopic pancreas is often misdiagnosed as gist.
slide.notesHtml:
I classified the EUS findings of ectopic pancreas into two types: superficial type and deep type.

In superficial type, the lesion is located in 2nd or 3rd layer.

In deep type, the lesion is located in 3rd, 4th, 5th layer. Therefore, the deep type ectopic pancreas is often misdiagnosed as GIST.
slide.text: Superficial type Deep type

slide.title: Subepithelial tumor
slide.text: Subepithelial tumor Color Cyst, Lipoma Vascular lesion Cushion sign Observation (6-12 mo) Surface erosion/ulceration Size ≥ 1 cm EUS Hypoechoic mass in 4th layer < 2 cm 2-5 cm > 5 cm translucent/yellow/bluish Rolling/Tenting sign Biopsy Observation (6 mo) Bite-on-bite biopsy EUS-FNA/FNB Endoscopic resection Operation (+) (+) (-) (-) (+) irregular margin cystic change (-) (-)
